Discussion of the education system invariably revolves around "reform" programs that fiddle at the edges, but few question the validity, usefulness or purpose of the education system as currently structured, at all.
 
 I would like to hear your views on whether "fixing" education is a matter of reform at all, or whether the public schools system is an inherently oppressive device.
